snippet: The front-runner, Abdullah Abdullah, won 45 percent of the votes, but it was not enough to avoid a runoff, forcing an election on June 14.
abstract: Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani, remaining candidates for president of Afghanistan, accept final results of the first round of voting, and vow to campaign hard to win the election in June 14 runoff; final results will be announced on July 22, and new president will be inaugurated 30 days later.

byline.contributor: Haris Kakar and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The front-runner, Abdullah Abdullah, won 45 percent of the votes, but it was not enough to avoid a runoff, forcing an election on June 14.

headline.main: Afghan Contenders Accept Results and Move On
headline.print_headline: Afghan Contenders Accept Results and Move On
